summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 regarding the creation of review batches for the 'Epstein SW database'. The correspondence involves requests to search for and batch documents containing specific email addresses (gmax, gmaxl, aace) as part of a review process, likely related to a search warrant execution.

events.title: Initial request for Epstein database batches
events.description: Initial email request to create review batches from the Epstein search warrant database for materials hitting on the terms 'gmax' and 'gmaxl'.

events.title: Follow-up search request for email addresses
events.description: Follow-up email requesting a search of the Epstein SW database for any email hitting on specific email addresses (gmax@, gmaxl, aace@) and creation of batches.

events.title: Confirmation of batch completion
events.description: Email indicating that the requested batches for the Epstein database search had been completed and were available for review.

events.title: Request to add batches for specific email addresses
events.description: Final email in the chain requesting the addition of batches for any email hitting on the addresses 'gmax' or 'gmaxl'.

keyFacts: The document references an 'Epstein SW database', indicating a database of materials obtained via search warrant(s) related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The review process involved creating batches of documents (approximately 500 each) that hit on specific search terms, notably email addresses containing 'gmax', 'gmaxl', and 'aace'.
The email chain spans from January to April 2021, showing an ongoing investigative or legal review process related to the Epstein case.
All sender/recipient names in the email chain are redacted or omitted, indicated by placeholders like 'Hi=,' and blank 'From:'/'To:' fields.
The correspondence is technical/administrative, focused on document review logistics rather than substantive allegations or events.
